Key Match Events: Bukayo Saka had a goal disallowed in the first half due to Phil Foden being offside.
Kobbie Mainoo was introduced at halftime, replacing Conor Gallagher, and brought more speed to England's passing.
Cole Palmer had a good chance in added time but shot too close to the goalkeeper.
Phil Foden's movement was the most incisive among England's forward players.
Slovenia secured their passage to the last 16 with the draw.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate will be under more scrutiny as England scored just two goals in three group games.
Slovenia's disciplined and diligent performance ensured their place in the knockout rounds.
England's last-16 opponents are yet to be confirmed, with the Netherlands a possibility.
England are now on the opposite side of the draw to Germany, Spain, Portugal, and France, so cannot meet any of those sides until the final.
Gallagher was removed at the break for Kobbie Mainoo, showing Southgate's displeasure at his latest midfield combination.
Palmer, like Mainoo, was bright off the bench and may now be in contention to start a knockout game on Sunday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England topped Group C at Euro 2024 after a goalless draw with Slovenia.
The introduction of Kobbie Mainoo at the interval brought a little more speed to England's passing.
Slovenia dug in for the draw towards the end, rather than pushing for a first-ever win at a European Championship.
Phil Foden demonstrated his value to the team with his movement.

Player ratings for England: Pickford 6, Walker 5, Stones 6, Guehi 6, Trippier 5, Rice 5, Gallagher 4, Saka 4, Bellingham 4, Foden 7, Kane 5. Subs: Mainoo 7, Palmer 6, Alexander-Arnold n/a, Gordon n/a.
Player ratings for Slovenia: Oblak 7, Karnicnik 7, Drkusic 6, Bijol 7, Janza 7, Stojanovic 6, Cerin 6, Elsnik 5, Mlakar 5, Sporar 6, Sesko 6. Subs: Ilicic 5, Celar n/a, Stankovic n/a, Balkovec.
